{"step_by_step_thinking": "COVID-19 is a novel disease and research is ongoing. As of now, there are vaccines available that can help prevent the disease. However, these vaccines are not typically used post-exposure as a treatment or prevention method. Instead, they are used to build immunity over time. There are also treatments available for those who have contracted the disease, but these are not preventative measures. Therefore, there are no medications available to prevent COVID-19 following exposure.", "answer_choice": "B"}
